channel.title: Ubuntu 10.04 + windows belkin wireless card?
channel.description: As some of you know, my computer went to shit. I repaired it, by formatting my harddrive and installing Ubuntu. Is there a way i can get my old Windows Belkin wireless card to work? (im currently wired into my internet with a 2 foot cord)

item.title: Ubuntu 10.04 + windows belkin wireless card?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:9, topic:342472”]b[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=438879.msg3225317#msg3225317 date=1275521945]

Search for the drive online, they should have it for Linux.

Already searched Google, and all i found, was stuff stating they didn’t maker the drivers for Ubuntu. I am installing Wine, and i hope that might get it working.

Wine doesn’t have anything to do with drivers. If there isn’t a linux driver for it you can use a windows driver with ndiswrapper like the above said.
[/quote]

Well i got it to reconize the device, but it doesnt connect to anything. no erreors either…[/quote]

Maybe you have to unpack some firmware? Like for broadcom you have to run the command ‘b43-fwcutter’

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu 10.04 + windows belkin wireless card?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:9, topic:342472”]b[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=438879.msg3225317#msg3225317 date=1275521945]

Search for the drive online, they should have it for Linux.

Already searched Google, and all i found, was stuff stating they didn’t maker the drivers for Ubuntu. I am installing Wine, and i hope that might get it working.

Wine doesn’t have anything to do with drivers. If there isn’t a linux driver for it you can use a windows driver with ndiswrapper like the above said.
[/quote]

Well i got it to reconize the device, but it doesnt connect to anything. no erreors either…[/quote]

sudo ifconfig wlan0 up

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu 10.04 + windows belkin wireless card?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

b[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:342472”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=438879.msg3225197#msg3225197 date=1275515387]

Search for the drive online, they should have it for Linux.

Already searched Google, and all i found, was stuff stating they didn’t maker the drivers for Ubuntu. I am installing Wine, and i hope that might get it working.
[/quote]

Wine doesn’t have anything to do with drivers. If there isn’t a linux driver for it you can use a windows driver with ndiswrapper like the above said.[/quote]

Well i got it to reconize the device, but it doesnt connect to anything. no erreors either…

item.title: Ubuntu 10.04 + windows belkin wireless card?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:6, topic:342472”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=438879.msg3225192#msg3225192 date=1275515091]
Search for the drive online, they should have it for Linux.
[/quote]
Already searched Google, and all i found, was stuff stating they didn’t maker the drivers for Ubuntu. I am installing Wine, and i hope that might get it working.[/quote]

Wine doesn’t have anything to do with drivers. If there isn’t a linux driver for it you can use a windows driver with ndiswrapper like the above said.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu 10.04 + windows belkin wireless card?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:2, topic:342472”]Do you need wireless when you have a wired connection.

Also it should recognize it automatically. I never had to do anything to get the drivers.[/quote]
Well i dont feel like being in the living-room just to be on the computer.

It doesnt, otherwise i wouldn’t be asking -.-

Read full topic
